article.paragraph: Anna Sergeyevna Kournikova(lang-rusА́нна Серге́евна Ку́рниковаˈannə sʲɪrˈɡʲejɪvnə ˈkurnʲɪkəvəAnna_kournikova.ogg; born 7 June 1981) is aRussianformer professional tennis player. Her appearance and celebrity status made her one of the best known tennis stars worldwide. At the peak of her fame, fans looking for images of Kournikova made her name one of the most common search strings onGoogle Search.cite webhttp://www.google.com/press/zeitgeist2001.html2001 Year-End Google Zeitgeist: Search patterns, trends, and surprises8 July 2009Googlecite webhttp://www.google.com/press/zeitgeist2002.html2002 Year-End Google Zeitgeist: Search patterns, trends, and surprises8 July 2009Googlecite webhttp://www.google.com/intl/en/press/zeitgeist2003.html2003 Year-End Google Zeitgeist: Search patterns, trends, and surprises9 July 2009Google

Despite never winning a singles title, she reached No. 8 in the world in 2000. She achieved greater success playing doubles, where she was at times theList of WTA number 1 ranked playersWorld No. 1player. WithMartina Hingisas her partner, she wonGrand Slam (tennis)Grand Slam titlesinAustralian OpenAustraliain1999 Australian Open1999and2002 Australian Open2002. They referred to themselves as the "Spice Girlsof Tennis".cite newshttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/tennis/wimbledon/7682605/Laura-Robson-and-Jamie-Murray-want-mixed-doubles-wild-card-for-Wimbledon.htmlRobson and Jamie want mix dubs WCThe Daily TelegraphUK5 May 20105 May 2010MarkHodgkinsonhttp://web.archive.org/web/20100510030913/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/tennis/wimbledon/7682605/Laura-Robson-and-Jamie-Murray-want-mixed-doubles-wild-card-for-Wimbledon.html10 May 2010no

Kournikova's professional tennis career ended prematurely at the age of 21 due to serious back and spinal problems, including aSpinal disc herniationherniated disk.cite webhttp://blogs.montrealgazette.com/2010/02/18/alla-kournikova-not-mother-of-the-year/Alla Kournikova – not mother of the yearMylesStephanie18 February 2010[[Montreal Gazette]]10 August 2013She lives inMiami Beach, FloridaMiami Beach, Florida, and plays in occasional exhibitions and in doubles for theSt. Louis AcesofWorld Team Tennis.She was a new trainer for season 12 of the television showThe Biggest Loser, replacingJillian Michaels (personal trainer)Jillian Michaels, but did not return for season 13. In addition to her tennis and television work, Kournikova serves as a Global Ambassador forPopulation Services International's "Five & Alive" program, which addresses health crises facing children under the age of five and their families.cite webhttp://www.concierge.com/cntraveler/blogs/80days/2009/02/day-one-child-s.htmlAnna Kournikova in Haiti, Day One: Child SurvivalThe Daily Traveler27 February 200925 August 2011
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Anna Kournikova was born inMoscow,Russia, on 7 June 1981. Her father, Sergei Kournikov (born 1961),cite webhttp://community.kournikova.com/showthread.php?tAnna's official discussion forumCommunity.kournikova.com10 March 2012a formerGreco-Roman wrestlingchampion, eventually earned a PhD and was a professor at the University of Physical Culture and Sport in Moscow. As of 2001, he was still a part-time martial arts instructor there. Her mother Alla (born 1963) had been a400 metres400-metre runner.Her younger brother,Allan KournikovaAllan, is a youth golf world champion who was featured in the 2013 documentary filmThe Short Game.cite webhttp://www.pga.com/news/golf-buzz/anna-kournikova-little-brother-allan-blossoming-golf-championAnna Kournikova's Little Brother is a Blossoming Golf ChampionHolmes, John[[Professional Golfers Association]]2014-06-222013
Sergei Kournikov has said, "We were young and we liked the clean, physical life, so Anna was in a good environment for sport from the beginning".

Kournikova received her first tennisracquetas a New Year gift in 1986 at age 5. Describing her early regimen, she said, "I played two times a week from age six. It was a children's program. And it was just for fun; my parents didn't know I was going to play professionally, they just wanted me to do something because I had lots of energy. It was only when I started playing well at seven that I went to a professional academy. I would go to school, and then my parents would take me to the club, and I'd spend the rest of the day there just having fun with the kids."cite webhttp://www.sportsmates.com/index.php?cmdAbout Anna KournikovaSportsmates12 May 200810 March 2012yeshttps://web.archive.org/20110716121817/http://www.sportsmates.com/index.php?cmd16 July 2011In 1986, Kournikova became a member of theSpartak Tennis Club, coached by Larissa Preobrazhenskaya.cite webhttp://www.kournikova.com/about/bioOfficial Biography of Anna KournikovaKournikova.com10 March 2012In 1989, at the age of eight, Kournikova began appearing in junior tournaments, and by the following year, was attracting attention from tennis scouts across the world. Kournikova signed a management deal at age ten and went toBradenton, FloridaBradenton, Florida, to train atNick Bollettieri's celebrated tennis academy.
article.heading: Tennis career
19891997: Early years and breakthrough
article.paragraph: Following her arrival in the United States, Kournikova became prominent on the tennis scene.At 14, she won the European Championships and theRome MastersItalian OpenJunior tournament. She became the youngest player to win the 18-and-under division of the JuniorDunlop Orange BowlOrange Bowltennis tournament. By the end of the year, Kournikova was crowned theInternational Tennis FederationITFInternational Tennis FederationJunior World Champion U-18and Junior European Champion U-18.

In 1994, Kournikova received a wild card intoInternational Tennis FederationITFtournament in Moscow qualifications, but lost to third seededSabine Appelmans.cite webhttp://www.sonyericssonwtatour.com/page/Player/Info/0,,12781~4285,00.htmlPlayers | Info (Career in Review) | Anna KournikovaSony Ericsson WTA Tour10 March 2012She debuted in professional tennis at 14 in theFed CupforRussia Fed Cup teamRussia, the youngest player ever to participate and win.In 1995, she turned pro, and won twoInternational Tennis FederationITFtitles, inMidland, MichiganandRockford, Illinois. The same year Kournikova reached her firstWTA Tourdoubles final at theKremlin Cup. Partnering with1995 Wimbledon Championships1995 Wimbledongirls' champion in both singles and doublesAleksandra Olsza, they lost toMeredith McGrathandLarisa Neiland.

In 1996, she started playing under a new coach, Ed Nagel. Her six-year tenure with Ed would produce terrific results. At 15, she made herGrand Slam (tennis)grand slamdebut, when she reached the fourth round of the 1996US Open (tennis)US Open, only to be stopped by then-top ranked playerSteffi Graf, the1996 US Open Women's Singleseventual champion. After this tournament, Kournikova's ranking jumped from No. 144 to debut in the Top 100 at No. 69.Kournikova was a member of the Russian delegation to the1996 Olympic GamesinAtlanta, Georgia. In 1996, she was namedWTA AwardsWTA Newcomer of the Year,and she was ranked No. 57 in the end of the season.

Kournikova entered the1997 Australian Open Women's Singles1997 Australian Openas World No. 67,cite webhttp://www.sonyericssonwtatour.com/page/Player/Activity/0,,12781~4285,00.htmlPlayers | Activity | Anna KournikovaSony Ericsson WTA Tour10 March 2012where she lost in the first round to World No. 12Amanda Coetzer. At theRome MastersItalian Open, Kournikova lost to Amanda Coetzer in the second round. However, she reached the semifinals in the doubles partnering withElena Likhovtseva, before losing to the sixth seedsMary Joe FernndezandPatricia Tarabini.

At the1997 French Open Women's Singles1997 French Open, Kournikova made it to the third round before losing to World No. 1Martina Hingis. She also reached the third round in doubles with Likhovtseva. At the1997 Wimbledon Championships Women's Singles1997 Wimbledon Championships, Kournikova became only the second woman in theTennis open eraopen erato reach the semifinals in herThe Championships, WimbledonWimbledondebut, the first beingChris Evertin1972 Wimbledon Championships1972; she still holds the record for being the youngest Wimbledon semifinalist in history (15 years of age).There she lost to eventual champion Martina Hingis.

At the1997 US Open Women's Singles1997 US Open, she lost in the second round to the eleventh seedIrina Sprlea. Partnering with Likhovtseva, she reached the third round of the women's doubles event.Kournikova played her lastWTA Tourevent of 1997 atPorsche Tennis Grand PrixinFilderstadt, losing to Amanda Coetzer in the second round of singles, and in the first round of doubles toLindsay Davenportand Jana Novotn partnering with Likhovtseva. She broke into the top 50 on 19 May, and was ranked No. 32 in singles and No. 41 in doubles at the end of the season.cite webhttp://www.kournikova.com/about/statsAnna Kournikova's Official Website – Tennis StatsKournikova.com10 March 2012
article.heading: 19982000: Success and stardom
article.paragraph: In 1998, Kournikova broke into theWomen's Tennis AssociationWTA'stop 20 rankings for the first time, when she was ranked No. 16. At the1998 Australian Open Women's Singles1998 Australian Open, Kournikova lost in the third round to World No. 1 player Martina Hingis. She also partnered with Larisa Neiland in women's doubles, and they lost to eventual champions Hingis andMirjana Luiin the second round.Although she lost in the second round of theParis Opento Anke Huber in singles, Kournikova reached her second doubles WTA Tour final, partnering with Larisa Neiland. They lost toSabine AppelmansandMiriam Oremans. Kournikova and Neiland reached their second consecutive final at theGenerali Ladies LinzLinz Open, losing to Alexandra Fusai and Nathalie Tauziat. At the Miami Open, Kournikova reached her first WTA Tour singles final, before losing toVenus Williamsin the final.

File:Anna Kournikova DF-SD-04-04709.jpgthumbleftAnna Kournikova practices herbackhandfor a match at the Family Circle Cup Tennis Tournament on Daniel Island in Charleston, South Carolina.Kournikova then reached two consecutive quarterfinals, atAmelia Islandand the Italian Open, losing respectively to Lindsay Davenport and Martina Hingis. At the German Open, she reached the semifinals in both singles and doubles, partnering withLarisa Neiland. At the1998 French Open Women's Singles1998 French OpenKournikova had her best result at this tournament, making it to the fourth round before losing to Jana Novotn. She also reached her first Grand Slam doubles semifinals, losing with Neiland to Lindsay Davenport and Natasha Zvereva. During her quarterfinals match at the grass-courtAEGON InternationalEastbourne OpenversusSteffi Graf, Kournikova injured her thumb, which would eventually force her to withdraw from the1998 Wimbledon Championships.However, she won that match, but then withdraw from her semifinals match against Arantxa Snchez Vicario.Kournikova returned for theRogers Cup (tennis)Du Maurier Openand made it to the third round, before losing to Conchita Martnez. At the1998 US Open Women's Singles1998 US OpenKournikova reached the fourth round before losing to Arantxa Snchez Vicario. Her strong year qualified her for the year-end1998 WTA Tour Championships, but she lost to Monica Seles in the first round. However, with Seles, she won her first WTA doubles title, in Tokyo, beating Mary Joe Fernndez and Arantxa Snchez Vicario in the final. At the end of the season, she was ranked No. 10 in doubles.

At the start of the 1999 season, Kournikova advanced to the fourth round in singles before losing toMary Pierce. However, Kournikova won her first doubles Grand Slam title, partneringMartina Hingis. The two defeatedLindsay DavenportandNatasha Zverevain the final. At theTier IFamily Circle Cup, Kournikova reached her second WTA Tour final, but lost to Martina Hingis.She then defeatedJennifer Capriati, Lindsay Davenport andPatty Schnyderon her route to theBausch & Lomb Championshipssemifinals, losing toRuxandra Dragomir. At The French Open, Kournikova reached the fourth round before losing to eventual champion Steffi Graf.Once the grass-court season commenced in England, Kournikova lost toNathalie Tauziatin the semifinals in Eastbourne. At Wimbledon, Kournikova lost toVenus Williamsin the fourth round. She also reached the final in mixed doubles, partnering withJonas Bjrkman, but they lost toLeander PaesandLisa Raymond. Kournikova again qualified for year-end WTA Tour Championships, but lost to Mary Pierce in the first round, and ended the season as World No. 12.

File:Kournikova-Hingis-SYD-1.jpgthumb300pxrightKournikova (left) with doubles partnerMartina Hingis.While Kournikova had a successful singles season, she was even more successful in doubles. After their victory at the Australian Open, she and Martina Hingis won tournaments in Indian Wells, Rome, Eastbourne and the WTA Tour Championshiops, and reached the final of The French Open where they lost toSerena WilliamsSerenaand Venus Williams. Partnering with Elena Likhovtseva, Kournikova also reached the final inStanford. On 22 November 1999 she reached theList of WTA number 1 ranked playersWorld No. 1ranking in doubles, and ended the season at this ranking. Anna Kournikova and Martina Hingis were presented with theWTA AwardsWTA Award for Doubles Team of the Year.

Kournikova opened her2000 WTA Tour2000 seasonwinning theMondial Australian Women's HardcourtsGold Coast Opendoubles tournament partnering withJulie Halard. She then reached the singles semifinals at theMedibank International Sydney, losing to Lindsay Davenport. At the2000 Australian Open, she reached the fourth round in singles and the semifinals in doubles. That season, Kournikova reached eight semifinals (Sydney,State Farm Women's Tennis ClassicScottsdale, Stanford, San Diego,Fortis Championships LuxembourgLuxembourg, Leipzig and2000 WTA Tour Championships), seven quarterfinals (Gold Coast, Tokyo, Amelia Island, Hamburg, Eastbourne, Zrich and Philadelphia) and one final. On 20 November 2000 she broke into top 10 for the first time, reaching No. 8.She was also ranked No. 4 in doubles at the end of the season.Kournikova was once again, more successful in doubles. She reached the final of the2000 US Open (tennis)2000 US Openin mixed doubles, partnering withMax Mirnyi, but they lost toJared Palmerand Arantxa Snchez Vicario. She also won six doubles titles Gold Coast (with Julie Halard), Hamburg (with Natasha Zvereva), Filderstadt, Zrich, Philadelphia and the 2000 WTA Tour Championships (with Martina Hingis).
article.heading: 20012003: Injuries and final years
article.paragraph: Her 2001 season was dominated by injury, including a left foot stress fracture which forced her withdrawal from twelve tournaments, including the2001 French OpenFrench Openand2001 Wimbledon ChampionshipsWimbledon.She underwent surgery in April.She reached her second careerGrand Slam (tennis)grand slamquarterfinals, at the2001 Australian OpenAustralian Open. Kournikova then withdrew from several events due to continuing problems with her left foot and did not return untilLeipzig. WithBarbara Schett, she won the doubles title in Sydney. She then lost in the finals in Tokyo, partnering withIroda Tulyaganova, and at San Diego, partnering withMartina Hingis. Hingis and Kournikova also won theKremlin Cup. At the end of the 2001 season, she was ranked No. 74 in singles and No. 26 in doubles.

File:Kournikova-SYD-1.jpgleftthumbAnna KournikovaAt theMedibank International Sydneyin 2002Kournikova was quite successful in 2002. She reached the semifinals ofAuckland, Tokyo,Acapulcoand San Diego, and the final of theChina Open (tennis)China Open, losing toAnna Smashnova. This was Kournikova's last singles final. WithMartina Hingis, she lost in the final at Sydney, but they won their secondGrand Slam (tennis)grand slamtitle together, the2002 Australian OpenAustralian Open. They also lost in the quarterfinals of the2002 US Open (tennis)US Open. WithChanda Rubin, Kournikova played the semifinals of2002 Wimbledon ChampionshipsWimbledon, but they lost toSerena WilliamsSerenaandVenus Williams. PartneringJanet Lee, she won the Shanghai title. At the end of 2002 season, she was ranked No. 35 in singles and No. 11 in doubles.

In 2003, Anna Kournikova collected her firstGrand Slam (tennis)grand slammatch victory in two years at the2003 Australian OpenAustralian Open. She defeatedHenrieta Nagyovin the 1st round, and then lost toJustine Henin-Hardennein the 2nd round. She withdrew from Tokyo due to a sprained back suffered at the Australian Open and did not return to Tour until Miami. On 9 April, in what would be the final WTA match of her career, Kournikova retired in the 1st round of theFamily Circle CupinCharleston, South Carolina, due to a left adductor strain. Her singles world ranking was 67. She reached the semifinals at theInternational Tennis FederationITFtournament inSea Island, GeorgiaSea Island, before withdrawing from a match versusMaria Sharapovadue to the adductor injury. She lost in the 1st round of the ITF tournament in Charlottesville. She did not compete for the rest of the season due to a continuing back injury. At the end of the 2003 season and her professional career, she was ranked No. 305 in singles and No. 176 in doubles.

Kournikova's twoGrand Slam in tennisGrand Slamdoubles titles came in 1999 and 2002, both at the Australian Open in the Women's Doubles event with partnerMartina Hingis. Kournikova proved a successful doubles player on the professional circuit, winning 16 tournament doubles titles, including two Australian Opens and being a finalist in mixed doubles at theUS Open (tennis)US Openand at Wimbledon, and reaching the No. 1 ranking in doubles in theWomen's Tennis Associationtour rankings. Her pro career doubles record was 20071. However, her singles career plateaued after 1999. For the most part, she managed to retain her ranking between 10 and 15 (her career high singles ranking was No.8), but her expected finals breakthrough failed to occur; she only reached four finals out of 130 singles tournaments, never in a Grand Slam event, and never won one.

Her singles record is 209129. Her final playing years were marred by a string of injuries, especially back injuries, which caused her ranking to erode gradually. As a personality Kournikova was among the most common search strings for both articles and images in her prime.
article.heading: 2004present: Exhibitions and World Team Tennis

link.part: Kournikova at a USO-sponsored tour atForward Operating BaseSharana on 15 December 2009

article.paragraph: Kournikova has not played on theWTA Toursince 2003, but still plays exhibition matches for charitable causes. In late 2004, she participated in three events organized byElton Johnand by fellow tennis playersSerena WilliamsandAndy Roddick. In January 2005, she played in a doubles charity event for theIndian Ocean tsunamiwithJohn McEnroe,Andy Roddick, andChris Evert. In November 2005, she teamed up withMartina Hingis, playing againstLisa RaymondandSamantha Stosurin the WTT finals for charity. Kournikova is also a member of the St. Louis Aces in theWorld Team Tennis(WTT), playing doubles only.

In September 2008, Kournikova showed up for the 2008 Nautica Malibu Triathlon held atZuma BeachinMalibu, California.Anna Kournikova showed up yesterday for the 2008 Nautica Malibu TriathlonSportsmatesThe Race raised funds for children's Hospital Los Angeles. She won that race for women'sK-Swissteam.On 27 September 2008, Kournikova played exhibition mixed doubles matches inCharlotte, North Carolina, partnering withTim WilkisonandKarel Novek.Sport Mates Gallery: Mixed Doubles Exhibition in Charlotte, North CarolinaSportsmatesKournikova and Wilkison defeatedJimmy AriasandChanda Rubin, and then Kournikova and Novacek defeated Rubin and Wilkison.

On 12 October 2008, Anna Kournikova played one exhibition match for the annual charity event, hosted byBillie Jean KingandElton John, and raised more than $400,000 for the Elton John AIDS Foundation and Atlanta AIDS Partnership Fund.The annual charity event raised more than $400,000 for the Elton John AIDS Foundation and Atlanta AIDS Partnership FundSportsmatesShe played doubles withAndy Roddick(they were coached by David Chang) versusMartina NavratilovaandJesse Levine(coached by Billie Jean King); Kournikova and Roddick won.

Kournikova competed alongsideJohn McEnroe,Tracy AustinandJim Courierat the "Legendary Night", which was held on 2 May 2009, at the Turning Stone Event Center inVerona, New York.Big Time Tennis Names to CNYCNY Central, 17 March 2009The exhibition included a mixed doubles match of McEnroe and Austin against Courier and Kournikova.

In 2008, she was named a spokesperson forK-Swiss.cite press releasehttp://www.prnewswire.com/cgi-bin/stories.pl?ACCTK-Swiss Announces Anna Kournikova As New Spokesperson for the Brand9 April 200822 February 2008K-Swisshttp://web.archive.org/web/20080509064358/http://www.prnewswire.com/cgi-bin/stories.pl?ACCT9 May 2008noIn 2005, Kournikova stated that if she were 100% fit, she would like to come back and compete again.Elle (magazine)ElleJuly 2005,page #?

In June 2010, Kournikova reunited with her doubles partnerMartina Hingisto participate in competitive tennis for the first time in seven years in the Invitational Ladies Doubles event at Wimbledon.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/tennis/8661576.stmHingis and Kournikova to return to WimbledonBBC Sport5 May 20105 May 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100508084023/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/tennis/8661576.stm8 May 2010nocite newshttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/tennis/wtatour/7680950/Martina-Hingis-and-Anna-Kournikova-to-be-reunited-for-double-act-at-Wimbledon.htmlMartina Hingis and Anna Kournikova to be reunitedThe Daily TelegraphUK5 May 20105 May 2010http://web.archive.org/web/20100508115632/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/tennis/wtatour/7680950/Martina-Hingis-and-Anna-Kournikova-to-be-reunited-for-double-act-at-Wimbledon.html8 May 2010noOn 29 June 2010 they defeated the British pairSamantha Smith (tennis)Samantha SmithandAnne Hobbs.cite newsAnna Kournikova and Martina Hingis turn on the old charm at WimbledonAndyBullhttp://www.guardian.co.uk/sport/2010/jun/29/anna-kournikova-martina-hingis-wimbledonThe GuardianGuardian News and MediaLondon0261-30776062387830 June 201020 June 2011
article.heading: Playing style
article.paragraph: As a player, Kournikova was noted for her footspeed and aggressive baseline play, and excellent angles and dropshots; however, her relatively flat, high-risk groundstrokes tended to produce frequent errors, and her serve was sometimes unreliable in singles.citation neededNovember 2013

Kournikova plays right-handed with a two-handedbackhand.She is a great player at the net.cite newshttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resSubstance Behind Those Shades7 July 200827 August 1996Selena RobertsNew York TimesShe can hit forceful groundstrokes and alsodrop shots.cite newshttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?resNew York Times7 July 200821 July 1997Ron DickerRubin Defeats Kournikova in Exhibition Final

Her playing style fits the profile for a doubles player, and is complemented by her height.cite webhttp://www.sweetannakournikova.com/bio.phpSweet Anna Kournikova – BiographySweetannakournikova.com7 June 198110 March 2012She has been compared to such doubles specialists asPam ShriverandPeter Fleming (tennis player)Peter Fleming.
article.heading: Personal life
article.paragraph: Kournikova was in a relationship with fellow RussianPavel Bure, anNational Hockey LeagueNHLice hockeyplayer. The two met in 1999 when Kournikova was still linked to Bure's former Russian teammateSergei Fedorov.cite newsPeople: Courtney Love, Scissor Sisters, Antonio Moralhttp://www.nytimes.com/2005/02/11/arts/11iht-peepsat.html12 July 200911 February 2005The New York TimesBure and Kournikova were reported to have been engaged in 2000 after a reporter took a photo of them together in a Florida restaurant where Bure supposedly asked Kournikova to marry him. As the story made headlines in Russia, where they were both heavily followed in the media as celebrities, Bure and Kournikova both denied any engagement. Kournikova, 10 years younger than Bure, was 18 years old at the time.cite newsKournikova and Bure wedding may be offhttp://www.independent.co.uk/sport/tennis/kournikova-and-bure-wedding-may-be-off-720494.html24 June 20096 April 2000The IndependentLondon

The following year, Kournikova and Fedorov were married in Moscow.Fedorov claimed he and Kournikova were married in 2001, and divorced in 2003.cite newshttp://www.cbc.ca/sports/story/2003/03/03/fedorov030303.htmlFedorov married, divorced Kournikova26 January 2007CBC Sports3 March 2003Kournikova's representatives deny any marriage to Fedorov; however, Fedorov's agent Pat Brisson claims that although he does not know when they got married, he knew "Fedorov was married".cite newshttp://www.cbc.ca/sports/story/2003/03/03/fedorov030303.html#ixzz0sP7fSbs3CBC NewsFedorov married, divorced Kournikova3 March 2003

Kournikova started dating pop starEnrique Iglesiasin late 2001 (she appeared in his video, "Escape").Moss, Corey."Enrique Iglesias Serves Up...". Retrieved 8 December 2013Kournikova has consistently refused to directly confirm or deny the status of her personal relationships. In June 2008, Iglesias was quoted by theDaily Star (United Kingdom)Daily Staras having married Kournikova the previous year and subsequently separated.cite newshttp://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/a104379/iglesias-anna-and-i-were-married.htmlIglesias: 'Anna and I were married'Digital SpyThe couple have invested in a $20 million home to be built on a private island in Miami.cite newshttp://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2063342/Anna-Kournikova-pregnant-She-belly-kissed-Enrique-Iglesias.htmlTum-ting to tell us Anna? A rounded Miss Kournikova has her belly kissed by beau Enrique Iglesias6 June 201219 November 2011[[Daily Mail]]Anisiobi, J. J.
Kournikova resides inMiami Beach, Florida.
article.heading: Media publicity
article.paragraph: File:Kournikova-SYD-2.jpg250pxthumbalt=Anna Kournikova playing tennis in white outfit. Left hand is extended as if she has just tossed a ball and right hand is cocking back for the serve.Kournikova preparing to serve in 2002Most of Kournikova's fame has come from the publicity surrounding her looks and her personal life. During her debut at the 1996 US Open at the age of 15, the western world noticed her beauty, and soon pictures of her appeared in numerous magazines worldwide.

In 2000, Kournikova became the new face forBerlei's shock absorbersports bras, and appeared in the "only the ball should bounce" billboard campaign.cite newsAnna Kournikova turns 30http://www.seattlepi.com/sports/gallery/Anna-Kournikova-turns-30-15347/photo-1036579.php11 June 2011Seattle Post-IntelligencerFollowing that, she was cast by theFarrelly brothersfor a minor role in the 2000 filmMe, Myself & IrenestarringJim CarreyandRene Zellweger.cite webhttp://espn.go.com/blog/afceast/post/_/id/26228/farrelly-brothers-talk-athletes-as-actorsFarrelly brothers talk athletes as actorsESPN23 February 20116 March 2012Graham, TimPhotographs of her have appeared on covers of various publications, includingList of men's magazinesmen's magazines, such as one in the much-publicized 2004Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue,cite newshttp://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/swimsuit/modelfeatured/anna_kournikova/2004/athletes/index.htmAnna Kournikova SI Swimsuit CollectionTurner Sports & Entertainment Digital Network21 September 2011where she posed in bikinis and swimsuits, as well as inFHMcite webhttp://www.fhm.com/girls/covergirls/anna-kournikovaAnna Kournikova – Courting attentionBauer MediaSeptember 2011andMaxim (magazine)Maxim.cite webhttp://www.maxim.com/amg/girls/todays-girl/44929/anna-kournikova.htmlAnna Kournikova She's grand slammin'.Alpha Media Group21 September 2011Kournikova was named one ofPeople (American magazine)People's50 Most Beautiful People in 1998cite webhttp://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20125205,00.htmlOur Fabulous 50 Most BeautifulTime21 September 2011and was voted "hottest female athlete" onESPN.com.cite webhttp://sports.espn.go.com/espn/page2/story?pagePage 2's Hottest Female AthleteESPN21 September 2011In 2002 she also placed first inFHM's 100 Sexiest Women in the Worldin US and UK editions.By contrast,ESPNciting the degree of hype as compared to actual accomplishments as a singles playerranked Kournikova 18th in its "25 Biggest Sports Flops of the Past 25 Years".cite newshttp://sports.espn.go.com/espn/espn25/story?pageBiggest Sports FlopESPNKournikova was also ranked No. 1 in the ESPN Classic series "Who's number 1?" when the series featured sport's most overrated athletes.

She continued to be the most searched athlete on the Internet through 2008 even though she had retired from the professional tennis circuit years earlier.cite newshttp://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_verWeb Users Have Spoken: Paris Hilton Is the Most-Searched Term of 2005 – Lycos Announces the Most Popular Internet Search Terms of 2005 and the Ones to Watch in 2006 Eminem, Web's Most Wanted Man; The Simpsons, Top TV Show; Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire, Top Movie; Green Day, Top Band; Hurricane Katrina, Most- Searched News Event22 July 200912 December 2005[[PR Newswire]]cite newshttp://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_verWeb Users Have Spoken: Poker is the Most-Searched Term of 2006...LYCOS Announces the Most Popular Internet Search Terms of 2006 and the Ones to Watch in 2007 – Iran Nuclear Program, Most-Searched News Event; Perez Hilton, Most-Searched Blog Site Clay Aiken, Web's Most Wanted Man; Pamela Anderson, Most-Searched Woman "American Idol", Top TV Show; "High School Musical", Top Movie; Green Day, Top Band22 July 200913 December 2006[[PR Newswire]]cite newshttp://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_verLycos Announces the Most Popular Internet Search Terms of 2007 and the Ones to Watch in 2008 – POKER Trumps all Other Search Topics to Top Lycos Year-End List for 2nd Consecutive Year SADDAM HUSSEIN EXECUTION, Most-Searched News Event of 2007; "DANCING WITH THE STARS", Top TV Show; "TRANSFORMERS", Top Film BRITNEY SPEARS, Most-Searched Woman, CLAY AIKEN Web's Most Wanted Man TMZ, Most Popular Blog Site22 July 200910 December 2007[[PR Newswire]]cite newshttp://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_verWireless News: Lycos Reveals Its Most Popular Internet Search Terms of 200822 July 200917 December 2008Wireless NewsAfter slipping from first to sixth among athletes in 2009,cite webhttp://www.yearinreview.yahoo.com/2009/blog/22Tiger Woods, Most Searched Athlete9 December 201024 December 2009Yahoo!she moved back up to third place among athletes in terms of search popularity in 2010.cite webhttp://sportsmarketingblog.net/2010/12/01/yahoo-top-10-lists/Yahoo Top 10 Lists9 December 20101 December 2010

In October 2010, Kournikova headed to NBC'sThe Biggest Loserwhere she led the contestants in a tennis-workout challenge.cite webhttp://www.tvguide.com/News/Biggest-Loser-Kournikova-1023826.aspxExclusive: Anna Kournikova Heads to Biggest Loser CampusTVGuide.com29 September 2010Anna Kournikova Making Appearance on 'The Biggest Loser',peoplestar.co.uk, Retrieved on 1 October 2010.In May 2011, it was announced that Kournikova would joinThe Biggest Loseras a regular celebrity trainer in season 12.cite webhttp://insidetv.ew.com/2011/05/24/biggest-loser-hires-anna-kournikova/Anna Kournikova joins 'Biggest Loser' as celebrity trainer for next seasonew.com24 May 2011http://web.archive.org/web/20110525052447/http://insidetv.ew.com/2011/05/24/biggest-loser-hires-anna-kournikova/25 May 2011noShe did not return for season 13.cite webhttp://news.yahoo.com/anna-kournikova-gets-dumped-223432223.htmlnews.yahoo.com

In November 2010, she became an American citizen.cite webhttp://tucsoncitizen.com/usa-today-sports/2010/11/17/video-five-questions-with-tennis-star-anna-kournikova/Video: Five questions with tennis star Anna Kournikova28 November 201017 November 2010[[Tucson Citizen]]In 2011,Men's Health (magazine)Men's Healthnamed her one of the "100 Hottest Women of All-Time", ranking her at No. 29.cite webThe 100 Hottest Women of All-Timehttp://www.menshealth.com/sex-women/hottest-women-all-time[[Men's Health (magazine)|Men's Health]]3 January 20122011
article.heading: Influences on popular culture
article.paragraph: A variation of aWhite Russian (cocktail)White Russianmade withSkimmed milkskim milkis known as an Anna Kournikova.cite webThe Snows of RevolutionBoise Weekly2006http://www.boiseweekly.com/boise/the-snows-of-revolution/Content?oid31 December 2010In theList of playing-card nicknameslingoof thepoker (card game)pokervariationTexas Hold 'em, thehole cardsAceKing (playing card)King(unsuited) are sometimes referred to as an "Anna Kournikova", a term introduced by the poker commentatorVincent Van PattenVince van Pattenduring a WPT tournament because it "looks great but never wins".cite webhttp://www.texasholdem-poker.com/hand_nicknamesPoker nicknamescite newshttp://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_verFT Weekend Magazine – Non-fiction: Stakes and chips Las Vegas and the internet have helped poker become the biggest game in town22 July 200919 May 2007Financial TimesAspden, Petercite newshttp://docs.newsbank.com/openurl?ctx_verA little luck helps out22 July 200915 July 2007[[Sunday Tasmanian]]Martain, TimA video game featuring Kournikova's licensed appearance, titledAnna Kournikova's Smash Court Tennis, was developed byNamcoand released for thePlayStationin Japan and Europe in November 1998.http://www.giantbomb.com/anna-kournikovas-smash-court-tennis/3030-15769/A computer virus named theAnna Kournikova (computer virus)Anna Kournikova virusarose on 12 February 2001.cite webhttp://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/anna-kournikova/bio/196062Anna Kournikova[[TV Guide]]cite bookhttp://books.google.com/books?idComputer network securityKizza, Joseph Migga[[Springer Science+Business Media|Springer]]0-387-20473-392–94
